meanings.definition: The quality or state of being subversive.
meanings.sent1: Her subversivenesses were evident in her rebellious attitude towards authority.
meanings.sent2: The subversivenesses of the group's actions led to a major political upheaval.
meanings.sent3: The subversivenesses of the prank were unexpected but harmless.
meanings.sent4: His art subtly conveyed the subversivenesses of societal norms.
meanings.sent5: The subversivenesses of the novel challenged readers' perspectives.

meanings.definition: The act of undermining or destabilizing authority or societal norms.
meanings.sent1: The subversivenesses of the protest caused a stir among the officials.
meanings.sent2: Political subversivenesses can have far-reaching consequences.
meanings.sent3: The subversivenesses of the children's game caught the teacher off guard.
meanings.sent4: The subversivenesses of the hacker group threatened national security.
meanings.sent5: The subversivenesses of the whistleblower exposed corruption within the organization.
